diagnosis.score_summary: Overall alignment is strong at 76/100, but this score masks a critical strategic divide. While executional elements like Visuals and Personality are consistent, the brand's core foundation—its Positioning, Mission, and Values—is schizophrenic, projecting an elite, aspirational brand on WWW and a mass-market, safety-focused brand on PDP.

truth_1.headline: Miracle vs. Medicine Cabinet
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW signals 'The Scientific Miracle,' positioning the product as a high-tech 'Investment Piece.' The PDP signals 'The Medical Authority,' positioning it as a reliable 'Daily Essential.' You are a luxury good on one channel and a functional staple on the other.
truth_1.evidence: [POSITIONING] WWW: 'The Scientific Miracle' (Value Perception: Investment Piece 4/5) vs. PDP: 'The Medical Authority' (Value Perception: Daily Essential 2/5)
truth_1.why_matters: This schizophrenia guts your pricing power. A customer who sees you as a 'Daily Essential' on Amazon will never pay the 'Investment Piece' price you aspire to on your own site, eroding brand equity.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are trying to be both a luxury and a staple, which is the fastest way to be neither. The data demands a choice. Option A: Surrender to your mass-market success, align the WWW to the 'Medical Authority' position, and win on volume. Option B: Discipline the Amazon channel to signal 'Investment Piece,' protecting your premium dream at the risk of sales velocity. You cannot be a miracle drug and a generic aspirin at the same time.

truth_2.headline: Elite Vanguard vs. Mass Democratizer
truth_2.gap_description: On your website, you are 'The Scientific Vanguard,' an aspirational leader of a 'Skin Tech Revolution.' On Amazon, with a #2 Bestseller Rank, you are 'The Democratizers,' making advanced skincare approachable and accessible to all. One mission is about exclusivity, the other is about volume.
truth_2.evidence: [MISSION & VISION] WWW: 'The Scientific Vanguard' (Access Barrier: Aspirational 2/5) vs. PDP: 'The Democratizers' (Access Barrier: Approachable 4/5)
truth_2.why_matters: A brand's mission dictates strategy, hiring, and partnerships. Are you building a team to collaborate with elite research labs or to manage a high-volume supply chain? This confusion paralyzes long-term growth by trying to go in two opposite directions at once.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: Your brand's soul is split between the few and the many. Option A: Embrace your role as a 'Democratizer,' rewriting your mission to celebrate bringing Korean skin tech to the masses. Option B: Defend your 'Vanguard' mission by making the Amazon channel feel more exclusive, sacrificing the Bestseller Rank to build a more defensible, premium brand story. A revolution for the elite cannot also be a staple for everyone.

truth_3.headline: Pushing Limits vs. Playing It Safe
truth_3.gap_description: The WWW communicates a core value of 'Radical Transparency' to prove its 'High-Performance' claims, signaling potency and efficacy. The PDP communicates a value of 'Safety First,' emphasizing its '0.00% irritation index' and suitability for sensitive skin. One channel promises power, the other promises protection.
truth_3.evidence: [VALUES] WWW: 'Radical Transparency' (Performance Priority: High-Performance 4/5) vs. PDP: 'Safety First' (Performance Priority: Hypoallergenic 1/5)
truth_3.why_matters: This conflict alienates both of your target customers. The performance-seeker sees the 'Safety First' message and assumes the product is weak. The sensitive-skin user sees the 'High-Performance' message and assumes it's too harsh. You are losing customers at both ends of the spectrum.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: You are selling a race car by advertising its great airbags. The market needs to know what you stand for. Option A: Commit to being the 'Safety First' brand, messaging gentle efficacy to win the massive sensitive skin market. Option B: Own your 'High-Performance' value, lean into the potent actives, and accept that you will alienate some users to win the results-driven consumer. You can be powerful or you can be perfectly safe, but you cannot lead with both.

truth_4.headline: Trapped in the Laboratory
truth_4.gap_description: Both channels are consistently aligned as 'The Chemist,' leading with ingredients and clinical proof. This is a strength, but also a hidden risk. The brand's entire story rests on having the best numbers, with no emotional narrative to fall back on. This makes you incredibly vulnerable to the next competitor with a better spec sheet.
truth_4.evidence: [MESSAGING] Persuasion Logic Drift: WWW 'Rational' (2/5) vs. PDP 'Raw Data' (1/5)
truth_4.why_matters: A brand built solely on data is in a perpetual arms race that is expensive to win and easy to lose. Without an emotional moat, your customer loyalty is only as deep as your latest clinical trial results. You are winning transactions, not building a brand.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your brand is a spreadsheet—highly effective but lacking a soul. This consistency is a hidden risk because you have no moat beyond your data. The choice is stark: either double down on being the undisputed data king, investing heavily in R&D to always have the best stats (Option A), or begin weaving a more human narrative into your 'Chemist' messaging to build a brand that can survive being out-specced (Option B). Data builds transactions, but stories build loyalty.

truth_5.headline: The Healer is a Bestseller
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels perfectly align on the core purpose of 'The Healer'—using clinical authority to solve skin problems. The untapped strength lies in the PDP's commercial data, which proves this purpose is a runaway success in the mass market. Your most successful focus group is telling you what works, but your WWW isn't fully listening.
truth_5.evidence: [PURPOSE] Perfect Alignment (100%) on 'The Healer' territory, validated by PDP's #2 Bestseller Rank and 13,949 reviews.
truth_5.why_matters: The market has given you a clear verdict: your core purpose resonates at scale. The hesitation to fully embrace this mass-market success on your own site is leaving growth on the table and fueling the strategic confusion highlighted in your top gaps. The PDP isn't a rogue channel; it's the blueprint for your future.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon success proves that your 'Healer' purpose has massive mainstream appeal, yet your website still whispers of a more exclusive brand. You must choose: either treat the PDP's success as a tactical anomaly and continue building a niche brand on your WWW (Option A), or accept the market's verdict, align your entire strategy to the mass-market 'Healer' that is already winning, and scale aggressively (Option B). The market has told you who you are; the only question is whether you are willing to listen.

marker_1.so_what: The brand's core purpose as 'The Healer' is perfectly consistent, providing a strong foundation despite strategic contradictions elsewhere.

marker_2.so_what: A critical disconnect in mission creates confusion about whether the brand is an exclusive leader or an accessible staple for the masses.

marker_3.so_what: The brand's values are schizophrenic, promising high-potency results on one channel and gentle safety on the other, confusing the target customer.

marker_4.so_what: A fundamental positioning gap erodes price perception, signaling 'premium investment' on WWW and 'everyday essential' on PDP.

marker_5.so_what: The brand's personality as 'The Reliable Expert' is highly consistent, projecting competence and authority across both channels.

marker_6.so_what: The archetype mix shows minor drift, swapping the authoritative 'Ruler' on WWW for a more transformative 'Magician' on PDP, a subtle shift in its promise.

marker_7.so_what: The clinical, authoritative tone of voice is highly consistent, reinforcing the brand's scientific credibility.

marker_8.so_what: A perfectly consistent 'Pharma-Code' visual identity ensures the brand looks and feels like a credible, scientific entity on both channels.

marker_9.so_what: Messaging is consistently clinical and data-driven, but this strength is brittle and vulnerable to competitors with better stats.

marker_10.so_what: The 'Lab Breakthrough' narrative is consistent, but a slight drift in setting suggests a more sterile story on PDP.

marker_11.so_what: The reliance on 'Derm-Validation' and clinical stats as proof points is perfectly consistent across channels.

marker_12.so_what: The brand's unique selling proposition as 'The Tech Engineer'—focused on its delivery system—is consistent and well-communicated.

marker_13.so_what: A consistent focus on 'Science Education' builds trust by explaining the 'how' and 'why' behind the product's efficacy.

marker_14.so_what: The functional benefit of 'Correction' is highly aligned, though WWW signals a slightly more aggressive 'Fixer' approach than PDP.

marker_15.so_what: The emotional benefit of 'Intelligence' is consistent, though PDP provides more 'Reassurance' while WWW offers 'Contentment'.

marker_16.so_what: Self-expression as 'The Pragmatist' drifts; WWW signals a choice for 'Curated' enthusiasts while PDP signals the mass-market 'Standard'.

marker_17.so_what: A critical gap in social benefits creates confusion: is using this product a signal of joining an exclusive 'Club' (WWW) or making 'The Safe Choice' with the majority (PDP)?
